canonical_explanation.text: When two lines intersect, they form pairs of angles with special properties. Complementary angles add up to 90 degrees, supplementary angles add up to 180 degrees. Vertically opposite angles are equal. When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, it creates corresponding angles (equal), alternate interior angles (equal), and co-interior angles (supplementary).
rules: Linear pair: adjacent supplementary angles on a straight line
Corresponding angles are equal (when lines are parallel)
Alternate interior angles are equal (when lines are parallel)
Co-interior (same-side interior) angles are supplementary (when lines are parallel)

questions.question_text: What is the complement of 35 degrees?
questions.explanation_correct: Complement = 90 - 35 = 55 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Complementary angles add to 90 degrees. 90 - 35 = 55.

questions.question_text: What is the supplement of 110 degrees?
questions.explanation_correct: Supplement = 180 - 110 = 70 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Supplementary angles add to 180 degrees. 180 - 110 = 70.

questions.question_text: Two angles are complementary. If one is 48 degrees, what is the other?
questions.explanation_correct: 90 - 48 = 42 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Complementary angles sum to 90. The other angle = 90 - 48 = 42 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two supplementary angles always add up to 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: By definition, supplementary angles add up to 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Supplementary means their sum is 180 degrees. This is always true.

questions.question_text: Can two obtuse angles be complementary?
questions.explanation_correct: Each obtuse angle is more than 90 degrees, so their sum exceeds 180 degrees, which is more than 90. They cannot be complementary.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An obtuse angle > 90 degrees. Two obtuse angles sum to more than 180, so they cannot sum to 90.

questions.question_text: The supplement of 90 degrees is ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: 180 - 90 = 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Supplementary: 180 - 90 = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two angles forming a linear pair are:
questions.explanation_correct: A linear pair of angles are adjacent angles on a straight line, so they add up to 180 degrees (supplementary).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Linear pair means angles on a straight line = 180 degrees = supplementary.

questions.question_text: If two angles are supplementary and one is twice the other, find the smaller angle.
questions.explanation_correct: Let angles be x and 2x. x + 2x = 180. 3x = 180. x = 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x + 2x = 180. x = 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two complementary angles are in the ratio 1:4. Find the larger angle.
questions.explanation_correct: 1+4=5 parts. 90/5=18. Larger = 4 x 18 = 72 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Total = 5 parts = 90 degrees. Larger = 4 x 18 = 72 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two lines intersect. If one of the vertically opposite angles is 65 degrees, what is the other vertically opposite angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Vertically opposite angles are equal. So the other is also 65 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vertically opposite angles are always equal.

questions.question_text: Two lines intersect forming four angles. If one angle is 70 degrees, find the adjacent angle.
questions.explanation_correct: Adjacent angles at an intersection form a linear pair: 180 - 70 = 110 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adjacent angles form a linear pair. 180 - 70 = 110 degrees.

questions.question_text: When a transversal cuts two parallel lines, corresponding angles are:
questions.explanation_correct: Corresponding angles formed by a transversal cutting parallel lines are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Corresponding angles are equal when lines are parallel.

questions.question_text: A transversal cuts two parallel lines. If one corresponding angle is 55 degrees, what is its corresponding angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Corresponding angles are equal when lines are parallel. So the angle is 55 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Corresponding angles are equal. The answer is 55 degrees.

questions.question_text: Alternate interior angles formed by a transversal cutting parallel lines are:
questions.explanation_correct: Alternate interior angles are equal when the lines are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When lines are parallel, alternate interior angles are equal.

questions.question_text: Co-interior angles (same-side interior angles) formed by a transversal cutting parallel lines are:
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles are supplementary (sum = 180 degrees) when lines are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Co-interior angles add up to 180 degrees when lines are parallel.

questions.question_text: If one co-interior angle is 120 degrees, the other is ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles are supplementary: 180 - 120 = 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Co-interior angles sum to 180. 180 - 120 = 60.

questions.question_text: In the figure, lines l and m are parallel. A transversal makes an angle of 72 degrees with line l. What is the corresponding angle with line m?
questions.explanation_correct: Corresponding angles are equal when lines are parallel. The angle is 72 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Corresponding angles with parallel lines are equal: 72 degrees.

questions.question_text: A transversal intersects two parallel lines. One alternate interior angle is 48 degrees. What is the other alternate interior angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Alternate interior angles are equal when lines are parallel: 48 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Alternate interior angles are equal with parallel lines: 48 degrees.

questions.question_text: If one co-interior angle is 75 degrees, find the other.
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles are supplementary: 180 - 75 = 105 degrees.

questions.question_text: If two lines are cut by a transversal and the corresponding angles are 50 degrees and 50 degrees, are the lines parallel?

options.text: Only if alternate angles are equal too

questions.explanation_correct: If corresponding angles are equal, the lines are parallel. This is the converse of the corresponding angles axiom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equal corresponding angles means the lines are parallel.

questions.question_text: Find the value of x if angles (3x + 10) degrees and (2x + 20) degrees are supplementary.
Two angles are complementary. If one exceeds the other by 20 degrees, find both angles.
Lines PQ and RS are parallel. A transversal makes angle 130 degrees on the same side with PQ. What is the angle on the same side with RS?
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles are supplementary: 180 - 130 = 50 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Same-side interior angles with parallel lines sum to 180: 180 - 130 = 50.

questions.question_text: A transversal cuts two lines making alternate interior angles of 65 degrees and 60 degrees. Are the lines parallel?

options.text: Only if they also have equal corresponding angles

questions.explanation_correct: For parallel lines, alternate interior angles must be equal. 65 â‰  60, so the lines are not parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Alternate interior angles are 65 and 60 (not equal), so the lines are NOT parallel.

questions.question_text: If angles A, B, and C are at a point on a straight line and A = 40 degrees, C = 80 degrees, find B.
questions.explanation_correct: Angles on a straight line sum to 180: 40 + B + 80 = 180. B = 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: In a figure, l || m. A transversal cuts them. Angle 1 = 3x and corresponding angle 2 = 2x + 25. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Corresponding angles are equal: 3x = 2x + 25. x = 25.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Corresponding angles equal: 3x = 2x + 25. x = 25.

questions.question_text: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. One interior angle on the same side is (2x + 10) degrees and the other is (3x - 5) degrees. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles are supplementary: (2x+10) + (3x-5) = 180. 5x + 5 = 180. 5x = 175. x = 35.

questions.question_text: Can two angles be supplementary if both are acute?
questions.explanation_correct: Each acute angle is less than 90 degrees. Two acute angles sum to less than 180 degrees. So they cannot be supplementary.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two acute angles sum to < 180 degrees, so they cannot be supplementary (which requires sum = 180).

questions.question_text: If the co-interior angles on the same side of a transversal cutting two lines are supplementary, then the lines are:
questions.explanation_correct: If co-interior angles are supplementary, the lines are parallel. This is the converse of the co-interior angles property.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Co-interior angles supplementary implies lines are parallel.

questions.question_text: The angles around a point sum to ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: All angles around a point form a complete revolution, which is 360 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A complete rotation around a point = 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: What is the complement of 0 degrees?
questions.explanation_correct: 90 - 0 = 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Complement = 90 - 0 = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: An angle and its supplement differ by 40 degrees. Find the angle.
questions.explanation_correct: Let angle = x. Supplement = 180 - x. Difference: (180-x) - x = 40. 180 - 2x = 40. 2x = 140. x = 70.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 180 - 2x = 40. x = 70 degrees.

questions.question_text: In the figure, AB || CD. A transversal EF makes angle AEF = 115 degrees. Find angle EFD (corresponding angle).
questions.explanation_correct: Corresponding angles with parallel lines are equal: angle EFD = 115 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Corresponding angles are equal: 115 degrees.

questions.question_text: If AB || CD and a transversal makes angle 62 degrees on one side with AB, what is the alternate interior angle at CD?
questions.explanation_correct: Alternate interior angles are equal with parallel lines: 62 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Alternate interior angles are equal: 62 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two lines are cut by a transversal. Angles on the same side of the transversal between the lines are 100 degrees and 80 degrees. Are the lines parallel?
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles sum = 100 + 80 = 180 degrees (supplementary). So the lines are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 100 + 80 = 180 (supplementary co-interior angles), so lines are parallel.

questions.question_text: Find the angle that is equal to its complement.
questions.explanation_correct: x + x = 90. 2x = 90. x = 45 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If x = 90 - x, then 2x = 90, x = 45.

questions.question_text: Find the angle that is equal to its supplement.
questions.explanation_correct: x + x = 180. 2x = 180. x = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: In the figure, PQ || RS. Transversal TU makes angle PTU = 50 degrees. Find angle TUR (the angle on the other side of the transversal at RS).
questions.explanation_correct: Angle PTU and angle TUR are co-interior angles (same side of transversal). They are supplementary: 180 - 50 = 130 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Co-interior angles with parallel lines: 180 - 50 = 130 degrees.

questions.question_text: In a figure, line l || line m. Angle a = 5x and alternate interior angle b = 3x + 28. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Alternate interior angles are equal: 5x = 3x + 28. 2x = 28. x = 14.

questions.question_text: If alternate interior angles formed by a transversal are equal, the two lines must be parallel.
questions.explanation_correct: This is the converse of the alternate interior angles theorem. If alternate interior angles are equal, the lines are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equal alternate interior angles is a sufficient condition for parallel lines.

questions.question_text: What is the supplement of a right angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Supplement = 180 - 90 = 90 degrees. A right angle is its own supplement.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 180 - 90 = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: How many pairs of corresponding angles are formed when a transversal cuts two lines?
questions.explanation_correct: A transversal cutting two lines creates 8 angles total, forming 4 pairs of corresponding angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are 4 pairs of corresponding angles when a transversal cuts two lines.

questions.question_text: In a figure, two straight lines intersect. One angle is (2x + 15) degrees and its vertically opposite angle is (3x - 10) degrees. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Vertically opposite angles are equal: 2x + 15 = 3x - 10. 25 = x.

questions.question_text: AB || CD. A transversal makes angle 40 degrees with AB. What angle does it make with CD on the same side?
questions.explanation_correct: Co-interior angles are supplementary: 180 - 40 = 140 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Same-side interior angles: 180 - 40 = 140 degrees.

questions.question_text: A transversal makes angles of 63 degrees and 117 degrees on the same side of two lines between them. Are the lines parallel?
questions.explanation_correct: 63 + 117 = 180 (supplementary). Co-interior angles are supplementary, so lines are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 63 + 117 = 180. Supplementary co-interior angles confirm parallel lines.

questions.question_text: Three angles at a point are 110 degrees, 85 degrees, and x degrees. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Angles around a point = 360. x = 360 - 110 - 85 = 165 degrees.

questions.question_text: If l || m and a transversal makes a 55-degree angle with l, the corresponding angle at m is ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: Corresponding angles are equal with parallel lines: 55 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Corresponding angles are equal: 55 degrees.

questions.question_text: The ratio of an angle to its supplement is 2:7. Find the angle.
questions.explanation_correct: 2+7=9 parts. 180/9=20. Angle = 2 x 20 = 40 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9 parts = 180. Angle = 2 x 20 = 40 degrees.

questions.question_text: If AB || CD and angle ABE = 125 degrees (exterior angle on the same side), find the interior angle BEF at CD on the same side.
questions.explanation_correct: The interior angle at AB = 180 - 125 = 55 degrees. The co-interior angles are supplementary. Actually, the exterior angle 125 and the interior angle at CD on the same side sum to 180: 180 - 125 = 55 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Interior angle = 180 - 125 = 55 degrees.

questions.question_text: In a figure, lines l and m are cut by transversal t. Angle 1 = 72 degrees, Angle 2 (alternate interior) = 72 degrees, Angle 3 (co-interior with angle 1) = 108 degrees. What can you conclude?
questions.explanation_correct: Alternate interior angles are equal (72 = 72) and co-interior angles are supplementary (72 + 108 = 180). Both confirm l || m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equal alternate interior angles and supplementary co-interior angles both confirm the lines are parallel.
